PGD Decomposition Documentation¶

Created on Wed Feb 14 15:35:41 2018

@author: Diego Britez

pgd_main.PGD(X, F, epenri=1e-10, maxfix=15)[source]¶

This function use the PGD method for a multivariate problem decomposition, returning an Canonical class objet.

Parameters:

X: This parameter is the list with all the vectors (as 1 dimention
array). It is the cartesian grid that describes the distribution of F in the space.

F: ndarray type, it’s the tensor that its decomposition is wanted.

epenri: Stop criteria value for the enrichment loop, default value=1e-10. This value is obtained by the divition of the first mode with the mode obtained in the last fixed-point iteration of the last variable (wich carries all the information of the module of the function), more detailed information can be find in Lucas Lestandi’s thesis.

maxfix:is the maximal number of iteration made inside of the fix point function before declare that the method has no convergence. Default value=15

Introduction to the PGD method

Be \(F\) the tensor that is going to be decomposed by the PGD method. And be \(u^{p}\) the solution, so we can express:

\(u^{p}=\sum_{m=1}^{p}\prod_{i=1}^{D}X_{i}^{p}(x_{i})\).

The weak formulation of the problem can be expressed as:

\(\int_{\Omega}u^{*}(u-F)=0\), is the test function,

for all \(u^{*} \in H^{1}(\Omega)\). If we take;

\(u^{*}=\prod_{i=1}^{s-1} X_{i}^{k+1}(x_{i})X^{*}(x_{s}) \prod_{i=s+1}^{D}X_{i}^{k}(x_{i})\),

the weak formulation becomes:

\(\int_{\Omega}[\prod_{i=1}^{s-1}X_{i}^{k+1}(x_{i})X^{*}(x_{s}) \prod_{i=s+1}^{D}X_{i}^{k}(x_{i})(u^{p-1}+\prod_{i=1}^{s}X_{i}^{k+1} (x_{i})\prod_{i=s+1}^{D}X_{i}^{k}(x_{i})-F)]=0\)

that for convenience it could be expressed like;

\(\alpha^{s}\int_{\Omega_{s}}X^{*}(x_{s})X_{s}^{k+1}(x_{s})dx_{s}= -\int_{\Omega_{s}}X^{*}\sum_{j=1}^{p-1}(\beta^{s}(j)X_{s}^{j}) dx_{s}+\int_{\Omega_{s}}X^{*}\gamma^{s}(x_{s})dx_{s}\)

where \(\alpha , \beta , \gamma\) are variables deduced from the precedent equation and that are expoded in the fix point variables section.
